result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher Robert Pittman

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 15, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing [or/and] random ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

1:22 PM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi and Intern Lanie Krause in court for DE, Defendant Kristopher Robert Pittman in court, in custody. INCLUDES 22CM665 (INIT), 21CM528 (RW), 22CM95 (RW), 22CM349 (RW), 11FA473 (HE), 22TR3480 (IN), 22TR3481 (IN) and 22TR3482 (IN). INIT 22CM665: DE qualifies for public defender. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. Court sets bond. 11FA473: Atty. Wagner requests $250 purge to be released. DE confirms address. Court orders $250 purge. QUASH WARRANT. Court sets Hearing. RW 21CM528, 22CM95 and 22CM349: QUASH WARRANTS. IN 22TR3480, 22TR3481 and 22TR3482: NG pleas. Court sets STC on all cases. Adjourned. kma
